fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Changes in the Plan are not being picked up in the commit/review changes dialogue (JPO3).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change any values in the plan
 # Observe no changes on Review Pending changes. Access to customer plan has been requested via support ticket - https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/PCS-10285

h3. Expected Results

Changes visible in Review Pending changes popup and can be saved
h3. Actual Results

No pending changes visible as Review Changes popup is opened.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Advanced Roadmaps - Cannot save to Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Tasks which have been moved from next-gen scrum to classic scrum project are not appearing in their classic scrum project backlog

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 On your next-gen scrum project
# create a Task
# associate the task with an Epic
# move the Task from this next-gen scrum project to a classic scrum project
# associate task from an Epic on the classic scrum project

h3. Expected Results
"To Do" Tasks to appear on Backlog

h3. Actual Results
Tasks are missing from Classic scrum project's backlog

h3. Workaround
Contact Support
fields.summary: Issues missing from the backlog (in classic) when moved from a next-gen project

fields.description:
We've gone to a lot of trouble to work with high-level management to define a unified vocabulary of statuses and the order they should be used in. Teams (in each Jira project) have a certain amount of leeway to determine which of the defined statuses they want to use and in which order, but that's the most freedom we want to allow.

However, many users have found that if they just create a new board, they can bypass the statuses we've created and make their own by using the Simplify Workflow button. This results in chaos, not only at the project management level, but for admins trying to keep a relatively clean set of workflows.

It would be very helpful to provide an instance-level setting to hide the Simplify Workflow button.
fields.summary: Allow site-admin or jira-admin to lock down "simplify workflow" at an instance level

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding a custom field of type select list is not reflected in Filters section of Advanced roadmaps.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the custom field select list into the Plan through Configure-> Custom fields.
 # Make sure the custom field is present in the appropriate screens in Jira.

h3. Expected Results
While filtering , it should give us the option to filter on custom field as per https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapscloud/filtering-issues-998651076.html

h3. Actual Results
Currently its not displayed.



h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Select list custom field added to Advanced roadmap plans is not reflected in Filters.

fields.description:
It would be great if we were able to automatically apply a filter for To Do/Doing/Done in the Backlog when you click the color-coded story point numbers associated w/ the active sprint?

Currently, you have to select each issue and open the side panel to see its status.

This feature would mean we can quickly identify and calculate the story points of the issues that might roll over to the next sprint.

Please see attached image explaining.

*Known Current workaround:*
You can create a Quick Filter that applies the same filter to the board by using a JQL query like `sprint in openSprints() and statusCategory.= "To Do"/"In Progress"/"Done"`
fields.summary: The ability to filter active backlog by status (eg Not Started, In Progress, Done)

fields.description:
At this moment, the view settings on a Plan (like sort order, filter, group By, Color) are not saved for users.
It would be nice if there was a way to save view settings per plan so that users are able to view the same settings when they switch browsers or share the plan with a team.
fields.summary: View settings on a Plan are not saved for users

fields.description:
*Background:*

It's common for all teams to go through the situation of previously identified scope or scenario being identified on run-time during a sprint. Most common solution is to split the newly identified scenarios and scope into a separate issue and link the two issues and the Split Issue feature does a perfect job of this currently when accessing the Backlog view.

However, there are some limitations in using the Spilt Issue and it would be extremely useful for the Product Owners and Product Manager communities using Jira is the following options would be available.
 * Ability to split issue in an active sprint using the split issue function via
 ** Issue options by right clicking the ticket
 ** More actions menu on issue details
 * Ability to split sub-tasks into multiple sub-tasks on the same issue or a separate issue
fields.summary: Ability to split issues and sub-tasks on Active Sprint board

fields.description:
I added a custom field "Paperino", but I can't see it in tickets. How can I do?

thank you

!image-2020-06-29-18-12-55-877.png!

!image-2020-06-29-18-12-14-135.png!



!image-2020-06-29-18-10-43-908.png!
fields.summary: Cusom fields in all tickets

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, you cannot add the Original Estimate field to the new experience.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add this field to the new experience.

h3. Why this is important
Customers need to set original estimate in live plans
fields.summary: Show original estimates in Advance Roadmaps

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We have the following scenario: we have two users viewing the same board (backlog). If one user creates an issue in the backlog, the other user doesn't have their page automatically either the banner "This board has been updated: Refresh" is being displayed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Jira Software project
# Access its board
# Open the same project and using the browser's incognito mode
# Create an issue using one browser tab
# Look at the board in the incognito mode

h3. Expected Results

The created issue is visible on the board or the message This board has been updated: Refresh" is displayed

h3. Actual Results

To see the newly created issues, the user needs to manually refresh the page from times to times

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The classic boards aren't automatically updating either notifying users that changes were made

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you resize the issue detail view in the backlog, the comment options will be hidden inside the plus (*+*) sign button:
 !Screen Shot 2020-06-26 at 10.18.04.png|thumbnail! 

The problem is that you won't be able to scroll down on that list to select the other options.

Check this recording:  [^Comment options.mp4] 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Access a board's backlog;
* Click on an issue to open its detail view;
* Resize the detail view;
* Click on the plus sign to open the other formatting options.

h3. Expected Results

You will be able to scroll down the list to select the other options.

h3. Actual Results

You are not able to scroll down the list.

h3. Workaround

Make sure to be on full screen, and resize the detail view to its max extension:  [^Comment options 2.mp4]
fields.summary: You can't scroll down in the hidden comment's format options list in the issue detail view

fields.description:
we frequently get bugs/stories etc with missing information and we request information by putting the issue into "needs more info". this can happen at any point in the workflow.

 

It would be great if when the person provides the info JIRA's default behaviour would be to change assignee and issue status to what it was before going into needs more info
fields.summary: When information provided to Needs more Info Issue should return to previous state

fields.description:
Hello Support,

  We are planning to use Test case management tool, we checked Katalon and TestRail tool it say Free in the App store.

We need more clarification so we can think of using this tool in our Jira Software.
fields.summary: Information about Test case management tool

fields.description:
I would like that new issues created inside the backlog (next-gen) to start at the top of the backlog instead of the bottom of the backlog.

Another option would be to let project administrators customize it, they would have the option to customize where new issues created inside of the backlog would start, the bottom or the top of the backlog.
fields.summary: Next-gen backlog - I would like to have issues created on the backlog to start at the top of the backlog.

fields.description:
There is currently no way to select multiple cards in a Next-Gen sprint and move them all to a new column. 

Drag and Drop for multiple issues does work in in the backlog, but not in a sprint. 

Would be great if this was possible!
fields.summary: Drag & Drop multiple cards in Next-Gen boards

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When grouping by Release, sub-tasks do not appear when their parent story is assigned to a release
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a plan
 # Create a release in the plan
 # Create a story
 # Create a sub-task for the story
 # Assign the story to the release (created in step 2)
 # Use view settings to group the plan by release

h3. Expected Results

You should see the sub-task as a child of the story in the release section
h3. Actual Results

The sub-task is not shown.
h3. Workaround

The only workarounds are to add the sub-task to the release or to not group by release.
fields.summary: Grouping by release hides sub-tasks of stories assigned to that release

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, the *Show rolled-up values in fields* setting only allows for rolling up fields such as Estimations but is not applied for date picker fields like the *Start date* and *Due date*.

h3. Proposed solution

With this is enabled, the parent Issue should have a rolled-up value from its child Issues for its date picker fields.

The *Start date* field will take the earliest date found from its child Issues. The *Due date* field will take the latest date found from its child Issues.

 !roll.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Rolled-up date values

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Dependency pop up doesn't have scroll bar and sometimes part of the pop up is hidden

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 Try clicking on a ticket with several dependencies (this is intermittent) or add a few dependencies to the issue (the pop up won't be adjusted)

h3. Expected Results
Dependency pop up has scroll bar

h3. Actual Results
Part of the pop up is hidden
 !Screen Recording 2020-06-23 at 06.56 PM.gif|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround
Close the pop up and open it once again
fields.summary: Dependency pop up doesn't have scroll bar

fields.description:
Ability to collapse the plan settings and have more issues displayed on roadmap

h3. Problem Definition
Users can only view 10 tickets if the browser zoom is set at 100%

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to collapse the plan settings and have more issues displayed on roadmap

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Ability to collapse the plan settings and have more issues displayed on roadmap

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you start a Sprint with a date *before* the completion date from the previous Sprint, the unresolved issues from the previous Sprint will be added as a Scope Changed on the started Sprint

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Complete a Sprint 1 with unresolved issues and send these issues to a Sprint 2
# Start the Sprint 2 with a date *before* the date you completed the Sprint 1

h3. Expected Results
The issues should be added to Sprint 2 without Scope Change

h3. Actual Results
The issues will be added as Scope Change on Sprint 2

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Creating a Sprint with a start date before completing the previous Sprint can cause Scope Changed
Setting an issue source where the overall sum of issues in the board exceeds the limit fails even if selecting a version that has less than the limit

fields.description:
"For example, If we have external client I would be interested to limit his issue creation right to only bugs, features, external client requests Users like me strongly need this possibility."

More granular approach to permissions grant more flexibility. Situation when I am looking for workaround through whole day, instead of use simple feature, is very unprofessional, and unproductive and honestly I'm bit pissed that some workarounds works only in server version. Cloud version is without solution at the moment.
fields.summary: Provide ability for permission schemes to be configured per issue type

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion 
Velocity Report Chart breakdown for Swimlane
fields.summary: Velocity Report Chart breakdown for Swimlane

fields.description:
Currently, the issues marked as done/completed are displayed without the start and end dates, and they are displayed as "grayed out".

As they’re completed, they aren’t being scheduled because done issues don’t need to be planned and don’t need people working on them.

Having the start and due dates visible in done issues could be helpful to understand the timeframe when people were working on them and when they were completed.
fields.summary: As an Advanced Roadmaps user, I want the start and due dates of the complete issues to be visible

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Currently, team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects are limited to *50* custom fields and *55* field options. When adding options above the limit, users get the following message:
{code}
You can't add more than 55 field options
{code}

h2. Suggestions

Allow team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects to have more custom fields
fields.summary: Increase custom field amount for team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Cross-Project Releases are limited to one single Release per Project and this doesn't allow for grouping multiple Releases from one Project into a single Cross-Project Release.

 !JPO3_MIXED_-_Advanced_Roadmaps_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Proposed solution

Allow for multiple Releases from the same Project to be added into a single Cross-Project Release.

 !JPO3_MIXED.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add multiple releases from the same Project

fields.description:
Currently , when we group by "Projects" under view settings and all the project tabs are collapsed , no information related to timeline is displayed in Improved interface.

It would be nice to have this information displayed ( even when the rows are collapsed) , just like in the older interface. ( refer attachments).
fields.summary: Display timeline information when all the projects are collapsed in Improved interface.

fields.description:
It would be great if we have an integration for Azure Devops provided as a part of Jira, just like Bitbucket and Jenkins integrations available in Jira now. 

The app provided by Microsoft is of no good and doesnot perform well.
fields.summary: Native support for Integration with Azure Devops

fields.description: Support a WYSIWYG/Rich Text editor in Jira's old issue view. Don't require users to enter preview mode to see their changes.
fields.summary: WYSIWYG / Rich Text Editor in the old issue view

fields.description: Currently, 'Assigned to Me' is available under 'Your Work' and within Dashboards. This section is used to see an overview of issues assigned to yourself that have not yet been done. There is sorting functionality in the dashboard section to sort by name, ID, priority, etc. However, it would be useful to be able to allow each user to rearrange their 'Assigned to Me' section as a personal to-do list in the same way items can be rearranged in the backlog. This feature would be increasingly useful where multiple projects are in play.
fields.summary: Allow users to rearrange their 'Assigned to Me'

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira Roadmap macro fails to load next-gen project roadmap. The macro shows an empty window.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# go to a Confluence page
# insert the Jira Roadmap macro
# enter the jira instance (https://<instance>.atlassian.net)
# select a next-gen project that has a roadmap
#* the roadmap shows in the preview window
# click *Save*  

h3. Expected Results
The Jira macro shows the next-gen project roadmap.

h3. Actual Results
The Jira macro shows a blank window

h3. Workaround
Directly copy & paste Jira roadmap URL to the Confluence page which will display the Jira roadmap macro.
fields.summary: Jira Roadmap macro fails to load next-gen project roadmap

fields.description:
Currently, when a user accesses the "confirm what's in scope" step, only open issues are displayed and if a user deselects all epics and stories from this view, the closed issues are displayed in the plan and the only way to remove them from the plan is by adjusting the plan's filter.

As an Advanced Roadmaps user, I want the closed issues to be displayed in the "confirm what's in scope" step so I can be able to choose if I want to include closed issues or not to my plan or not.
fields.summary: As an Advanced Roadmaps user, I want to be able to choose if I want to include closed issues or not to my plan

fields.description:
1) Epics should automatically inherit due date from the latest date added into a subtask. There should be also an possibility to change Epic due date manually.

2) All subtasks should inherit start date from an Epic, and to have the possibility to change it manually.
fields.summary: Epic and sub tasks dates inheriting

fields.description:
Hi,

It would be really useful if we could forecast the delivery of the backlog by adding our velocity in and it showing a visual representation of what is estimated for each sprint. This will help us prioritise properly but also help manage stakeholders expectations in a quick visual way, without having to use another tool and spend a lot of manual time setting it up. 

 

TFS have done this and it's something I really miss using. The velocity value is manually entered and it shows an estimate of how many sprints it will take. Example: 

!https://www.deliveron.com/files/6114/2628/1514/image5.png!
fields.summary: Forecast the backlog visually using velocity

fields.description:
When an issue has a link from dropbox, the new issue view is displaying an odd integration *Connect to preview* but even connecting to my account, it still is being displayed:
 !replace1.png|thumbnail! 

However, on the old issue view, that sentence is not displayed:
 !replace3.png|thumbnail! 

It would be awesome if the new issue view would behave like the old issue view in that case.
fields.summary: Dropbox link is faulty

fields.description:
h3. Problem
h3. Suggested Solution

_Change time format for time tracking report on excel view to align with global time tracking settings._
h3. Why This Is Important

_Excel format is confusing for users to compare against UI report_
h3. Workaround

_Change format directly on Excel_
fields.summary: Change Time Format for Time Tracking Report on Excel View

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If the blocker ticket doesn't have estimation the  dependent issue is scheduled  before the blocker's date.

h3. Suggested Solution
Schedule dependent issues according to the start and due dates of the blocker regardless  the estimation field.

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Schedule dependent issues according to the blockers

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the *Auto-schedule*, estimated Issues are given a *Start date* and *Due date* that ignores the non-working days configured in the Issue source Board settings.

This makes the schedule display blocks of work that expand over these non-working days or weekend. Though weekends are not taken into account as mentioned in [Auto Scheduling Issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapscloud/auto-scheduling-issues-998651231.html], it is still booked in the timeline which can be misleading.

 !JPO3_Plan_-_Advanced_Roadmaps_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Propose solution

Include a logic for the *Auto-schedule* to avoid scheduling over weekends or non-working days selected on the *Working days* configured in the Issue source Board.

 !working_days.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Option to exclude non-working days or weekend in Auto-schedule

fields.description:
My customer wants to have the *Estimation tab available in Board settings for Kanban board* as we have it in Scrum board.

Request our Product and Development team to check the feasibility of this option in Kanban board.
fields.summary: Estimation tab availability in Board settings for Kanban board.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the current Advanced Roadmaps, the timeline provides an overview of dates based on the *Start date* and *Due date* Issue fields taken from the Issues themselves but doesn't provide much information on the Release dates when grouping by Release which makes it difficult to read.

h3. Proposed solution

When using the *Group by* feature to group by Release, the timeline show have distinguishable indicators that display the start/end date of each Release displayed.

In the example below, the timeline is *Grouped by* Release but I can't see the start/end dates for "Release to be burned" and have no way of identifying when this Release ends/start.

 !_JSWCLOUD-20441__Improve_Release_dates_timeline_when_grouping_by_Release_-_Create_and_track_feature_requests_for_Atlassian_products_.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Improve Release dates timeline when grouping by Release

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Roadmap shows a blank page with error if there are issues with corrupted data such as missing status or missing issue type.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Delete the status of an issue in database.
 # Go to Roadmaps page.

h3. Expected Results

Show a working roadmap.
h3. Actual Results

Roadmap show a blank page with generic error flag.
h3. Workaround

No workaround available, currently it could only be resolved by fixing the data in the database.
fields.summary: Corrupted issues cause Roadmap fails to load

fields.description:
When working in a scrum board with the old Jira issue view enabled, if we select any issue, and select *** at the right-side panel, there are the options to "Send to top" or "Send to bottom" the issue.

 !Screen Shot 2020-06-16 at 20.16.37.png|thumbnail! 

However, if we enable the new Jira issue view, the "Send to top" and "Send to bottom" options were not implemented, we must move the issue manually.

 !Screen Shot 2020-06-16 at 20.14.14.png|thumbnail! 

Depending on the number of issues that a customer has on his board, a huge work is needed to move the issues to the top or to the bottom of the sprint/backlog.

Please implement the "Send to top" / "Send to bottom" to the new Jira issue view, this missing feature has a huge performance impact depending on the customer's board size.
fields.summary: New Jira issue view - "Send to top" / "Send to bottom" options are missing.

fields.description:
Currently, the board's filter only accepts the clause {{ORDER BY Rank}}.

If a user uses {{ORDER BY RANK}} or {{ORDER BY rank}}, the board fails to recognize it and the users won't be able to reorder the issues on the board.

As a Jira Software user, I want the board's filter to not be case sensitive
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want the board's filter to not be case sensitive

fields.description:
The Jenkins plugin is currently sending a display name that matches the build number e.g. #17. On Development Panel > Builds > Pipeline, this is also displayed as a number. 

Suggestion : Display a more readable pipeline information for Builds coming from Jenkins.
fields.summary: Display a more readable pipeline name for Builds in Jenkins.

fields.description: Right now a Jira admin can create an user but not able to edit any user profile after creation. This is causing inconvenience in many ways. While exporting report the names mismatch with the record, there are no other option to filter/sort a report. In addition to editing user profile admin should have access to add additional information of an user like employee ID, date of joining, date of exit, date of birth etc. These options help in maintaining the user record up to date and help in exporting reports.
fields.summary: Admin should be able to edit user profile

fields.description: Currently, on the Roadmap in Next Gen (and soon to be Classic) projects, progress is shown based on the number of stories. Our teams would find it more valuable to show progress based on story points rather than number of stories. Otherwise, the progress bar assumes that every story is pointed equally, and that's not how our teams work.
fields.summary: Show Roadmap progress in story points rather than number of stories

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Users are unable to have floating capacity based on individuals capacity.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to schedule plans based on users capacity

h3. Workaround 
Use 1 member per team that way by setting the capacity for a team, this would translate to an individual
fields.summary: Add the ability to schedule plans based on users capacity

fields.description:
Hi,

In next gen projects we can activate a backlog, but we can't filter on issues that are in the backlog. 

Status is considered as the same as in your first column
fields.summary: Next-gen project, filter on backlog issues (as a status)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
Roadmap only displays 3k of issues/300 epics at the moment

h3. Suggestion
Increase issue limits for Roadmap view
fields.summary: Increase issue limits for Roadmap view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
For some customers, their Advanced Roadmaps plan page loads everything except the issues scope.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a plan page

h3. Expected Results
# The plan header shows and after a while the loading state of the roadmaps tab content gets replaced with the actual issues of that plan

h3. Actual Results
# The loading state remains active, issue data never renders

h3. Workaround
Clearing the browser's local storage resolves the issue, check [this page|https://support.google.com/accounts/answer/32050?co=GENIE.Platform%3DDesktop&hl=en] on how to do this for Chrome.
fields.summary: Opening an Advanced Roadmaps plan fails with the plan header shown but the roadmaps tab stuck in a loading state

fields.description:
When using the assignee quick filter and refreshing the page if we're on an *Active board* it retains the quick filters. However, when performing the same actions on the backlog, the quick filters are lost. 

It would be awesome to don't lose the quick filters per assignee after refreshing the page.
fields.summary: Assignee quick filter lost after refreshing page on backlog

fields.description:
When you do an advanced search you can use the link type as JQL parameter but that field is not available in the column options in the list view results.
 !image-2020-06-12-16-39-04-061.png|thumbnail! 

It would be very helpful to add that field to the column options to audit the usage of the link types.
fields.summary: Add link type to the advanced search (list view) results

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When users apply a filter on plan and perform the auto-schedule, the issues missing on view are also updated.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users to restrict the auto-schedule functionality to the filtered issues
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Allow users to restrict the auto-schedule functionality to the filtered issues

fields.description:
Currently, the notification bell is tied to the next table.
|Direct|Watching|
|Jira|Jira |
|All mentions|All notifications on issues that you are watching but do not own|
|Mentioned (anywhere)|Issue assigned (to anyone but you)|
|Issue assigned (to you) / unassigned (from you)|Issue transitioned|
| |Issue updated|
|The following activity on objects you own (issues you’re assigned to)|Comment created|
| |Comment updated|
|Issue transitioned| |
|Issue Updated| |
|Comment created/updated| |
| | |
|Reaction on your comment| |
| | |
|Share of issue| |
| |Note: Comment updates not supported|

It would be useful to add Bell configuration in which more recipients can be included like for example add if a Reporter of a ticket can receive also these Bell notifications.
fields.summary: Add a Bell configuration feature

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We have the following scenario: we have two users viewing the same board (backlog). If one user creates an issue in the backlog, the other user doesn't have their page automatically either the banner "This board has been updated: Refresh" is being displayed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Jira Software project
# Access its board
# Open the same project and using the browser's incognito mode
# Create an issue using one browser tab
# Look at the board in the incognito mode

h3. Expected Results

The created issue is visible on the board or the message This board has been updated: Refresh" is displayed

h3. Actual Results

To see the newly created issues, the user needs to manually refresh the page from times to times

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The next-gen boards aren't automatically updating either notifying users that changes were made

fields.description: It would be really useful for us if we could get the author of a commit in a smart value. It would hopefully enable me to set up automations that assign issues to a user when they make a commit. Likewise, we tag commits when creating releases and it would be useful to be able to get those from a commit where they exist so that we can use them to set fix versions. The DevOps triggers are great and are really helping but it would definitely be helpful to have access to more of the data in Bitbucket when we use them
fields.summary: Could you add development smart values to get author and tag for a commit?

fields.description:
As a user, I would like the ability to filter the roadmap view by JQL so that I can filter my results by more specific needs.

Example: We have a Blocked workflow status. We also use the Blocks issue link type. A ticket could be in a Blocked status because of a reason that is not related to another ticket so linking would not be feasible. However, I can only filter if a ticket has one of the dependency links OR by status. I can't have both in the same view.
fields.summary: JQL Support for Roadmap Filtering

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Automation now supports the use of development activity triggers such as 'Branch created' or 'Commit created'. However, it's not currently possible to leverage actions or conditions based on the user that created the branch or commit in the VCS.

As an example, the rule below does not assign the issue to the user that created the branch. It remains unassigned.
 !image-2020-06-11-15-35-46-218.png!
h3. Suggested Solution

Add support for mapping the user that performed the creation in the VCS for use in automation rules.
fields.summary: Development Activity User Mapping (DevOps)

fields.description:
Currently, the only way to edit link types from the issue linking page is by doing manually one by one, it would be helpful to have the possibility to do this like a bulk operation.

https://<site-name>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewLinkTypes!default.jspa
fields.summary: Bulk edit Link Types

fields.description:
I would like it if all Jira projects were linked to a summary page - possibly the README.md for the source repositories associated with the project.   Or to be able to link to a page in a workspace and navigate from that page.   Often one workspace contains documentation for multiple Jira Projects.

As a Release Engineer.  I'd like to be able to find the source repo (bitbucket, gitlab), build job/pipeline( jenkins,aws codebuild, gitlab),  test reports (zephyr) on the Jira projects page.  A bonus would be a way to find the tagged sources , build and test reports(zephyr) for a fixVersion
fields.summary: Jira Cloud, Pages link to  more than just a Confluence workspace

fields.description:
In Jira, the Pages feature allow to link a project with a space in the Confluence application on the same site. 

It would be beneficial if spaces from a remote Confluence site can be linked as well.
fields.summary: Allow spaces from remote Confluence site to be linked via Pages

fields.description:
Ability to restrict the 'original estimate' field to specific user group in Jira cloud. 

Currently, we do not have a feature to restrict this field.
fields.summary: Ability to restrict the 'original estimate' field to specific user group.

fields.description:
Currently with Advance Roadmaps we do not have a way to show issues from another instance in the Plan even when two instances have been connected with App links.

It would be helpful if we can integrate Plans in a way so the customers can have a read only view of the issues from another instance that has been connected with application links.

Workaround:

We do have an option to share a read only link of the Plans as shortcuts in another cloud instance:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapscloud/sharing-roadmaps-998651329.html
fields.summary: Ability to display issues (Epics, tasks ) from a connected cloud  instance
Recompute existing estimates for backlog items when switching planning unit
Add the concept of leadtime to epics and stories
Importing Completed Issues should set the status to Complete
Integrate Team Calendar in Portfolio for Jira
Stream names on Compact view
Allow to enter stage/skill-level estimates in percentages
Merge two portfolio plans
Import more than 100 issues
Jira portfolio Start and end dates value availability in JQL
Improve memory use of scheduling algorithm

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-352].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 24 March 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting! This issue is being addressed as part of the all new Portfolio live plans, which feature an entirely overhauled and more seamless integration model with JIRA Software / Agile. Live plans are currently available as a labs feature for both Server* and Cloud, so you can start evaluating them without any risk of impacting existing Portfolio plans. They are not yet feature-complete, we're working on bringing all major capabilities of standard plans back into live plans on top of the new integration model before we graduate live plans out of labs and make them the new standard way of working. 
Please check out this blog for a summary and short videos of how the top-voted suggestions are being addressed with live plans: [Top 10 suggestions addressed in live plans|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2016/03/10-user-suggestions-addressed-in-portfolio-for-jira/] and join our [Portfolio Pioneers LinkedIn group|https://www.linkedin.com/groups/7018171] to discuss feedback and best practices!
 
Thanks,
Martin Suntinger
[msuntinger@atlassian.com|mailto:msuntinger@atlassian.com]
Principal Product Manager, Portfolio for JIRA
 
^*The live plans labs feature is available with Portfolio for JIRA 1.12 or higher. It is compatible with JIRA Software 7.0.5 or higher, and JIRA 6.3 or higher, in association with JIRA Agile 6.7.12 or higher.^
{panel}

When releases are linked with versions in JIRA, and a different version is assigned to a JIRA issue, JIRA Portfolio should automatically suggest the new release when doing a "Plan > Update from date" operation
fields.summary: Plan Update - Automatically suggest changed release assignments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-333].
  {panel}

Currently, Portfolio does not offer separate fields to represent an Agile Epic's name and summary, both fields are represented by the Epic title in Portfolio.

*Current behaviour:*
When applying updates to linked Projects and and enabling summary syncing, the title configured in Portfolio is set to summary and name of the linked Agile Epic. The same goes for automatic two-way synchronization of summaries between JIRA and Portfolio. Changing either Epic name or summary in JIRA will propagate the new value to Portfolio. Changing the title in Portfolio will set Epic name and summary in JIRA.

*Desired behaviour:*
Portofolio provides a separate field for the Epic name (e.g., in the details page of a backlog item) and maps the title to the Epic summary. This way, the two fields could be synced independently and a change to the Epic title in Portfolio would then not unexpectedly overwrite the Epic name in JIRA.
fields.summary: Allow to manage Epic name and summary independently in Portfolio
Having an option for User to create custom fields in Portfolio to be shown as Column in the backlog and releases section

i created a team in my plan and added a few members.
then, i tried importing some issues; these tickets were already assigned to jira users who were added as the team member.  after the tickets are imported, the members fields are empty.  is assignee imported as part of the issue import?
fields.summary: import assignee

Just like in JIRA Agile where the user has the ability to prioritize issues among different issues, I'd like to have the same feature on JIRA Portfolio backlog. 

Scenario: When managing my backlog I noticed that there is an issue within an epic that needs to have a higher priority. So, I decided I want this specific issue on another epic with higher priority. JIRA Portfolio should allow me to "move" these issues around.
fields.summary: Allow individual issues priorization among different epics

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-334].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The current functionality of JIRA Portfolio allows for Sprint Dates And Release Dates to become out-of-sync, this can cause Stories to be scheduled outside the Release dates, into the 'Later' releases, having sprints with no Stories.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Releases that have Fixed End dates that do not correlate with the Sprint dates.
# Recalculate
# Select the "Stories" Icon. 

h3. Expected Results
An option to Sync up the Sprints would be nice, or some way to make it clear why there are empty Sprints. Alternatively, a default behaviour to start the release as early as possible to prevent empty sprints.

h3. Actual Results
It's not clear how the releases affect the arrangement of Stories into Sprints.

h3. Workaround
Adjust Sprints to start earlier than the calculated date by using "X Days _Before_" the previous release date for the start dates of Sprints.
fields.summary: Make Reason for Empty Sprints More obvious

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-391].
  {panel}

It would be helpful to add estimates to Epics or Stories and specify the burdown rate.

For example, If I have a release that is a fixed duration of 3 months. I have project management Epics and/or stories that need to be estimated and applied across the duration of the project.

A PM may estimate 100 hours of project management across the 3 month duration.

Today, this can be handled by setting up weekly project management stories across the duration of the project, but that is somewhat of an arduous task.

But, having a setting for applying a burndown rate would be helpful.
fields.summary: A new feature for slowing the burndown on issues would be helpful.
Be able to convert the actual estimates when changing the planning unit (hours-days)
Team commitment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-298].
  {panel}

Hi,

I'm not sure how this is supposed to work, it causes a lot of confusion here. We have about 20 Projects, which we enter as Initiatives. For these we enter epics and stories. All this is happening in the "Initiatives" view. We never even open the "Epics" view, because it's just a chaotic collection of epics without context. 
Now we prioritize by dragging up and down the initiatives and the release streams. 
What happens is: priority is not adjusted as we want, because the priority in the epics view (which we don't use) is overruling it.  
From my perspective the priorities between initiatives (on the initiatives view) have no effect at all. Whats the concept behind this?

Thanks, Juri
fields.summary: Sync Backlog priority changes in the epics and initiatives view
filter for epic when finalising before a certain date or starting after a certain date
Dashboard Gadgets for Portfolio

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-457].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently it is not possible to define resource allocation with percentage ratio and based on the time that can commit.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if we are able to allocate a resource (person) and then the percentage of time they could be used on a story/epic per line item in portfolio.
fields.summary: resource allocation with percentage
Allow to search by issue key when linking issues
Multiple releases on the same day arent seen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-388].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Sometimes an issue will be manually assigned to a developer (through the JIRA issue view). As JIRA Portfolio currently only allows synchronization of:
* Summary
* Description
* Estimation

Whenever the changes to the plan are pushed to the projects the assignee of those issues will be overwritten, and data may be lost.

h3. Suggested Solution
When an issue is assigned to an user, the assignee would be added as a member of the linked story on the plan.
fields.summary: As a user I'd like JIRA Portfolio to synchronize the assignee of stories
Support JIRA Cloud
Do not trigger scheduling for changes that don't affect the scheduling
Viewing and editing custom fields within Portfolio

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-129].
  {panel}

[MIGRATED from uservoice]

Our high-level roadmap is actioned by several different teams, running their own backlog from their own Jira project. It would be great to see the estimates gathered from the "teams" which will implement this roadmap item.

Use case: 
1. There is a high-level roadmap story of "list all orders from the server and display on mobile apps"

2. The work to achieve this is split between server team, and 4 app teams (for iOS, Android, BB, and Windows).

3. When defining a "story" in the roadmap, the stages, skills and estimates are gathered from linking the story to various teams. (For example: A story is created that just requires iOS and Server, links are created to 2xiOS and 1xServer stories, and the estimates are calculated).

4. The roadmaps story can be linked to several stories in each of the 5 team's backlog

5. Progress is shown by collating all of the estimates (days/hours/story points).

6. Team/Stage/Skill capacity is calculated by checking the team's velocity from within Jira
fields.summary: support high-level roadmaps
Stories with dependencies can still be scheduled to start at the same time
